title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4011.9 - Dead heats
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4011.9 - Dead heats

State Regulations
(a) In the event
of a dead heat either in the first race or second race of the daily double, two
winning combinations result. The amounts wagered on both winning combinations
are deducted from the net pool to determine the profit. This profit is divided
in half, and the halves, in turn, divided by the two amounts mentioned above. This determines the profit per dollar, to which is added the amount of the
wager. (b) In the event of a dead
heat in both races of the daily double, four winning combinations result. The
amounts wagered on these four winning combinations are deducted from the net
pool to determine the profit. This profit is divided into four equal parts, and
each part, in turn, divided by the four amounts mentioned above. This
determines the profit per dollar, to which is added the amount of the
wager. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4011.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
